meanings.definition: To increase rapidly in size or significance
meanings.sent1: Her savings were snowballing, growing bigger every day.
meanings.sent2: The project's success was snowballing, gaining attention from all over.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a surprise party for her was snowballing in everyone's minds.
meanings.sent4: His popularity was snowballing, spreading like wildfire among his peers.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room was snowballing, reaching a fever pitch.

meanings.definition: To gather snow into a ball and roll it to make it larger
meanings.sent1: The kids were snowballing in the yard, creating the perfect ammunition.
meanings.sent2: They enjoyed snowballing during the winter, laughing as they played.
meanings.sent3: The snowballing contest at the park was a fun way to spend the afternoon.
meanings.sent4: She was snowballing expertly, crafting the ultimate snowball for the battle.
meanings.sent5: The snowballing technique involved rolling the snowball in a circular motion.
